New Records: Sri Lanka and Netherlands set a Cricket World Cup record with a 130-run stand for the seventh wicket.
Key Match Events: Aryan Dutt's accurate bowling troubled Sri Lanka during their chase of 263.
Kusal Perera fell early when he failed to gain the elevation while going for a cut, and played one straight to the short third man.
Dilshan Madushanka (4/49) struck back for Sri Lanka in a brilliant final spell.
Sybrand Engelbrecht stitched together a 130 run stand with Logan van Beek for the seventh wicket.
Sri Lanka won the game in the 49th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka's two triumphs against Netherlands at the Qualifier stretched their unblemished run in ODIs between the teams to five wins from five, although this is the first time Sri Lanka bowled first in their 50-over clashes.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka began the chase positively but were rocked by two quick blows from Aryan Dutt in the first Powerplay.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka garnered their first ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 win in Lucknow.
Dilshan Madushanka (4/49) and Kasun Rajitha (4/50) starred with the ball for Sri Lanka.
Others: Kasun Rajitha was at his very best with the new ball.
Sri Lanka coach Anton Roux knows all about the qualities that Netherlands possess, ahead of the two nations' meeting at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
